content: bring the tail to the inside of the knocker leaving it uncut inside the knocker finishing if you are mailing your knocker s to our organization please leave your yarn tails as-is after threading the final one through those last stitches knotting and pulling it to the inside please send your knockers unstuffed we have volunteers who will take care of the finishing and stuffing for you knockers are needed in all sizes and colors so have fun making the knockers of your choice ©2022 tempe yarn and fiber revised 7-19-22 www knittedknockersusa org please share this pattern with anyone wishing to make knockers knitted knocker one-piece by knittedknockersusa org if you are making the knocker for personal use or to donate elsewhere make sure the tail is secured with a knot or woven into the fabric so it won t pull loose you do not need to cut the tails just leave them tucked inside additional information visit www knittedknockersusa org for information on stuffing knockers adding weights to them washing and donating them and for some design options if you would like to add a personalized label you can download a suggested format at knittedknockers info under label sizing knockers we have simplified the way you can tell the actual cup size of your finished knocker to do this flatten the knocker as flat as you can and measure across the diameter of the knocker then use the information below to determine the size of your knocker 5 inches across = size a 5½ inches across = size b 6 inches across = size c 6½ inches across = size d 7 inches across = size dd 7 ½ inches across = size ddd this pattern is provided by tempe yarn & fiber in support of knitted knockers charities increase knittedknockersusa com effort and may be copied and distributed for the use of making knitted knockers we realize that there are lots of creative people who might want to do it their way please keep in mind that this pattern has been developed tested and is based on feedback from numerous knitted knocker recipients if you modify the pattern and reprint it please include a reference and/or link back to this original pattern this pattern has been modified from the original design with help from mary who has been knitting knockers with us for the last 10 years and who also helps stuff and package them ©2022 tempe yarn and fiber revised 7-19-22 www knittedknockersusa org
